name: pyrrhic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
relating to a victory that is not worth winning because the winner has lost so much in winning it : Disraeli's personal triumph was very much a pyrrhic one for his party. The memo admitted that this agreement was a victory for Ireland, however Pyrrhic.
More examplesFewer examplesHis victory against the destruction of a local landmark took a Pyrrhic turn. Through no fault of his own, it was a pyrrhic triumph for the young boxer. For many businesses, online victories tended to be of the Pyrrhic variety.
